metadata.dc:author: Carrillo-Esper, Ra√∫l
metadata.dc:description: The innate immune response is the first line of defense against infection. Toll-like receptors (TLRs) recognize bacterial lipopolysaccharide and other pathogen-associated molecular patterns (PAMPs). Intracellular signals initiated by interaction between Toll receptors and specific PAMPs results in inflammatory response. Sepsis and septic shock are the result of an exaggerated inflammatory systemic response induced by innate immune dysregulation.
metadata.dc:title: Inmunidad innata, receptores Toll y sepsis.
[Innate immunity, Toll receptor and sepsis].
